        protected int counterTextColor
        the text color for the counterLabel text. DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR by default.

      • errorColor

        protected int errorColor
        the text color for when something is wrong (e.g. exceeding max characters, setError()). DEFAULT_ERROR_COLOR by default.

      • primaryColor

        protected int primaryColor
        the color for the underline, the floating label text and the icon signifier tint when HAVING focus. Current theme primary color by default.

      • secondaryColor

        protected int secondaryColor
        the color for the underline, the floating label text and the icon signifier tints when NOT HAVING focus. DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR by default.

      • panelBackgroundColor

        protected int panelBackgroundColor
        the color for panel at the back. DEFAULT_BG_COLOR by default.

      • iconSignifierResourceId

        protected int iconSignifierResourceId
        the resource ID of the icon signifier. 0 by default.

      • endIconResourceId

        protected int endIconResourceId
        the resource ID of the icon at the end. 0 by default.

      • isResponsiveIconColor

        protected boolean isResponsiveIconColor
        whether the icon signifier will change its color when gaining or losing focus as the label and the bottomLine do. True by default.

      • hasClearButton

        protected boolean hasClearButton
        whether to show the clear button at the end of the EditText. False by default.

      • hasFocus

        protected boolean hasFocus
        whether the EditText is having the focus. False by default.

      • alwaysShowHint

        protected boolean alwaysShowHint
        Whether the label is fixed at top when there's a hint. False by default.

      • useDenseSpacing

        protected boolean useDenseSpacing
        whether the field uses a dense spacing between its elements. Usually useful in a multi-field form. False by default.

      • setManualValidateError

        protected void setManualValidateError(boolean isManualValidateError)
        By default the field is validated each time a key is pressed and at construction, this means a field with a minimum length requirement will start in Error state. Set this value to true to validate only when validate() is called.
        Parameters:
        isManualValidateError - the new value

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Update the onError state of this component
        Returns:
        true if valid (the inverse value of onError)

      • validateError

        @Deprecated
public boolean validateError()
        Deprecated. Pseudonym for validate() to provide legacy support for a bad PR. Note: This does NOT validate that there is an error, it does the opposite

      • updateDimens

        protected void updateDimens(boolean useDenseSpacing)
        check if the TextFieldBox should use a dense spacing, then change the layout dimens accordingly

      • updateCounterText

        protected void updateCounterText(boolean performValidation)
        check if the character count meets the upper or lower limits,

        if performValidation and exceeds limit, setCounterError() otherwise removeCounterError()

        Parameters:
        performValidation - - true if error state should be applied or removed by this calls See setManualValidateError(boolean)

        NOTE: SPACE AND LINE FEED WILL NOT COUNT

      • updateBottomViewVisibility

        protected void updateBottomViewVisibility()
        check if the helper label and counter are both empty. if true, make the bottom view VISIBLE. otherwise, make it GONE.

      • setCounterError

        protected void setCounterError()
        set highlight color and counter Label text color to error color

      • removeCounterError

        protected void removeCounterError()
        set highlight color to primary color if having focus, otherwise set to secondaryColor set counterLabel Label text color to DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR

      • setError

        public void setError(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String errorText,
                     boolean giveFocus)
        set highlight color and helperLabel Label text color to errorColor set helperLabel Label text to error message
        Parameters:
        errorText - optional error message
        giveFocus - whether the field will gain focus when set error on

      • removeError

        public void removeError()
        set highlight to primaryColor if having focus, otherwise set to secondaryColor set helperLabel Label text color to DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR

        NOTE: WILL BE CALLED WHEN THE EDITTEXT CHANGES UNLESS YOU setManualValidateError(boolean) TO TRUE

      • setIsResponsiveIconColor

        public void setIsResponsiveIconColor(boolean isResponsiveIconColor)
        set whether the icon signifier will change its color when gaining or losing focus as the label and the bottomLine do.
        Parameters:
        isResponsiveIconColor - if true, the icon's color will always be HighlightColor (the same as the bottomLine) if false, the icon will always be in primaryColor
